title: Counter-terror measures could fuel 'resentment and division', Labour's Andy Burnham warns
text: Labour will support “reasonable and proportionate” surveillance and counter-terrorism legislation but reject proposals if they are too heavy handed, Andy Burnham has said. The shadow home secretary warned that the wrong approach by the Government on the issue could fuel " resentment, division and a sense of victimisation " among groups who felt they were targeted. David Cameron today unveiled plans to prevent people convicted of terror and extremism offences from working with children – which the government says will prevent youth “radicalisation”. Read more
